thread.title: Hero fire crews bring lifeless cat out of burning building | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Hero fire crews bring lifeless cat out of burning building | Daily Mail Online

author: Isobel Frodsham For Mailonline
title: Hero fire crews bring lifeless cat out of burning building | Daily Mail Online
text: It shows a mask being placed on the cat as firefighters gently push its chest. The cat then regains consciousness and is given water to clear its airways. As he makes the first 'meow', a firefighter is heard saying: 'Yes, that's good, talk nicely. Here you are, a little water.' A total of 15 flats had to be evacuated in the fire, which happened last year. Stan Loemers, Sammy's owner, lost all his possessions in the fire but said his cat was the only thing he cared about. It was captured on the bodycam of one of the firemen and shows them fitting an oxygen mask on to him As it makes the first 'meow', a firefighter is heard saying: 'Yes, that's good, talk nicely. Here you are, a little water' Sammy was taken to the vets for observation but was allowed to leave after a few days Mr Loemers said: 'Even if my house may have burned down three times, this animal means the world to me. 'Sammy is a bit old and a little chubby which is the likely reason as to why he did not dare to escape on his own.' Sammy was taken to the vets for observation but was allowed to leave after a few days. No one died in the blaze thanks to the firemen's quick action. Share or comment on this article 57
